programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Is 10,000 steps really a magic number when it comes to staying healthy?

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The village of Savoca has some of the best views in Sicily, which is why Martin Scorsese chose it to film The Godfather's wedding scene. Clive hangs out at the Bar Vitelli, made famous by the film, and chats to the café owner who played a bridesmaid. Staying just outside the village in a fishing hamlet that's been transformed into a unique hotel, Clive learns to make the perfect spaghetti sauce.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Magazine for the deaf community highlighting the latest issues.

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: A dalmatian puppy called Reg is rushed into the hospital after eating a mystery object that's become stuck in his intestines. A scan shows that there's only one way to get it out, and that's to operate. Rupert, a King Charles spaniel, has an appointment to see the experts in the neurology department to try to get to the bottom of his headaches, which can be common in this breed. Becky, his foster carer, would also like to find out what she can do to cure his life-threatening lung infections, and so clinical director Ben looks into his case. In the oncology department, the team are seeing Alexandria, a cat who is undergoing chemotherapy. They hope this will be her last chemo round and give her some well-deserved treats.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A suivre, les dernières actualités présentées par les équipes rédactionnelles de la BBC, le très réputé radiodiffuseur du service public britannique. Créée en 1922 à Londres, la British Broadcast Corporation est connue pour être la plus ancienne société diffusant des programmes de radio ou de télévision au monde.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Join presenter Jo Coburn as she discusses the latest political news and stories in a conversational format, covering the comings-and-goings from Westminster in the BBC's daily politics programme. Featuring opinions and arguments from all the sides of the political spectrum, the show invites informed and opinionated guests to share their views on the stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Game show in which players must avoid giving impossible answers to a set of questions.

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: General knowledge quiz featuring probably the greatest quiz team in Britain.

programme.title: Un menu en or
programme.desc: Des cuisiniers et des restaurateurs tentent de faire la promotion de leurs recettes devant des investisseurs. Les plus audacieux et talentueux ouvriront leur restaurant. (VO : Million Pound Menu).

programme.title: Cap sur l'Atlantique
programme.desc: Saison 1 Episode 2 Les îles volcaniques suivant la dorsale qui traverse l'océan Atlantique sont le lieu de rendez-vous de nombreux manchots, éléphants de mer et phoques. Année de réalisation : 2015

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers make dresses for summer week, outfits from hammocks and trousered co-ords.

programme.title: Flog It !
programme.desc: Flog It! comes from the University of Nottingham.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton, and Kirsty Wark face more trivia questions.

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive celebrated his 40th birthday in Sicily, but like most visitors, he stuck to the beaches. Now he's travelling inland in the footsteps of his travel hero, the 19th-century African-American writer Booker T Washington. He also meets people from around the world who've bought homes in the Euro house hub of Mussomeli and discovers Italy's best street food in the island's capital Palermo.

programme.title: Les motards poilus : Cooking Trip en Méditerranée
programme.desc: David Myers et Simon King, reprennent du service ! Direction la Méditerranée, pour une aventure gourmande gorgée de soleil. Cette fois-ci, les motards poilus partiront à la découverte des saveurs authentiques de cette fameuse cuisine méditerranéenne en se rendant en Italie, en traversant les îles Baléares pour terminer leur food trip sur les côtes espagnoles.

programme.title: Banjo: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo has two hospitality clients on the Isle of Mull, each with unique challenges. The B&B owners of the local castle want their unloved turret turned into a destination for guests, while the owner of a remote lighthouse wants to attract visitors by revamping a guest bedroom. Contending with tricky logistics and bad weather, Banjo and the team must go above and beyond to complete two makeovers in these stunning locations.

programme.title: Wales' Home of the Year
programme.desc: The judges are in the south east where they must choose between a converted nursing home in Pontypridd, a 1930s semi-detached in Caerleon and a former borstal school outside Chepstow. Scoring them on architectural merit, distinctive design and original style, which home will Owain, Mandy and Glen choose to go forward to the grand final?

programme.title: Coronation Tailors: Fit for a King
programme.desc: The Great British Sewing Bee's Patrick Grant goes behind the scenes at the family firm making ceremonial uniforms for King Charles's coronation. Tasked with creating thousands of bespoke uniforms for the big day, the Kashket family have been making spectacular ceremonial wear for four generations. As well as discovering the skill and craftmanship required to create these unique garments, Patrick also meets some of the men and women of the armed forces who will wear them.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: In-depth news and current affairs review of the main political and economic stories of the day, featuring robust interviews with senior government and opposition figures, business and trade union leaders.

programme.title: David Harewood: Psychosis and Me
programme.desc: David Harewood had a psychotic breakdown and was sectioned in his 20s. David traces his steps, meeting young people living with psychosis and the NHS professionals who treat them.

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: Magazine for the deaf community highlighting the latest issues.

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay invites the teams to Henley Regatta to launch cocktails in a can.

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Cardiac surgeon Betsy Evans finally gets to operate on her longest-waiting patient.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven remaining cooks face a challenge set by food critic Jay Rayner.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: This is BBC Two.
